Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery plate; pale orange clay with white inclusions and some silver mica; cream slip, dark brown and red paint; exterior: bands, three below rim, one on mid-wall, one around foot; accidental blob of glaze near rim; hook maeander band on top of rim; on floor, lotus flower and bud frieze and in tondo slight remains of star of lozenges and buds; dividing bands with added red bands lined in white; red patches on parts of lotus flowers and on lozenges.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.753)
